column1: Today is #SmallBusinessSaturday! Remember to support local entrepreneurs and #shopsmall! https://t.co/YzSFuo0BNe

Chinese fentanyl is flooding our country and killing Americans. The Chinese government needs to go after those running this massive fentanyl operation in their country and should consider executions as punishment. Democracy loving folks in China have been executed for much less. https://t.co/Mvc9Fv4FXh

Alzheimer’s Disease has impacted many Americans including my Aunt Jane and my Aunt Virginia. I’m grateful for my family members who made sacrifices to serve as caregivers for both my aunts. Visited Washburn today for a tour of Hurst Trailers. https://t.co/JqNYbWazUy

There are real heroes in this world and they aren’t music stars famous athletes or Hollywood actors. Our country’s heroes are the men and women of our armed forces. This #VeteransDay join me in thanking all those who’ve served and sacrificed for our great nation. https://t.co/IlLuGaYs1Y
Live from @RamisCafe on @Joy620WRJZ with Bob Bell talking about honoring our veterans this Veteran’s Day. https://t.co/BQsuow28qD

Today marks the United States Marine Corps' 245th year of service. My dad - a Marine - served in the Pacific in World War II and his stories stay with me to this day. Thank you to all brave Marines for defending our country and values. https://t.co/2c7z91d0Zy
Glad I got the opportunity to stop by the Tennessee Veterans Business Association’s Veterans Day event. We appreciate all TVBA does to support our veteran-owned businesses. https://t.co/5XGhjHw4mX
My statement on the current situation with the 2020 Presidential Election. Every legal ballot must be counted through a transparent process. https://t.co/WF1DU6UKXJ

Responsible action on #COVID19 has been delayed for months while @SpeakerPelosi plays politics and obstructs Paycheck Protection Program legislation. Congress needs to get back to work and leave political agendas at home. My latest opinion in @knoxnews ⬇️ https://t.co/dyIphB5R2m

Visited my alma mater today for lunch with my friend Clay Spencer. I was really impressed with the great job our teachers and school administrators are doing during this pandemic. Thanks for all you do for our kids. https://t.co/pCqVkepj6L

Enjoyed spending time in Claiborne County today touring Thompson Farms. Farmers do important work and I appreciate these folks taking time out of their busy day to show me around. https://t.co/9TnR5D9hWO

Join me in congratulating Avery Burnham South Doyle U.S. Army JROTC Cadet Battalion Commander for being awarded the Legion of Valor Bronze Cross for Achievement. I’m proud of the positive role model Avery is in our community and all hard work he put into this accomplishment. https://t.co/3vKjGeF9Kr

I appreciate the Financial Executives International Knoxville Chapter inviting me to be the guest speaker at its October meeting. I enjoyed sharing a legislative update and taking questions from the crowd. https://t.co/XdLzh5QQQB

As a state legislator county mayor and now as a Congressman the success of small business owners and their employees has always been a top priority of mine. I am honored to receive @NFIB's Guardian of Small Business award for the 116th Congress! https://t.co/TWwgOGzn1F

From a political science class at William Blount High School to a Webelos meeting in east Knox County it was great visiting with young folks who want to learn more about civics and how our government works. https://t.co/QsDuqyM5rz

The Trump Administration recently announced it will form the United States One Trillion Trees Interagency Council. As an original cosponsor of @RepWesterman's Trillion Trees Act it's good to know Congress has this administration's support in this effort.  https://t.co/bYeUzQ37Id
Social media is for sharing different ideas and opinions. By censoring @PressSec and the @nypost article @Twitter is biased against views they disagree with. https://t.co/deyDtWyCue

Fall is usually a busy time for Capitol tours in my Washington office. Although we cannot host in-person Capitol building tours for families and students this fall East Tennesseans can still experience the Capitol by taking my virtual tour! https://t.co/w2X4FytAqb

Today I introduced a resolution to require the cost of all bills to be read on the House Floor before members cast their votes. The American public deserves to know how much of their money Congress is spending especially if a bill drafted in secret. https://t.co/5ZRB8I9IO6

Attention East Tennessee veterans: TRICARE open season starts November 9. Remember if you want to keep your TRICARE Select Group A coverage you must take action to set up a monthly payment plan or you will be disenrolled from TRICARE. Learn more below.  https://t.co/baMhI6EQv2

Yesterday I spoke with Postmaster General DeJoy about my concerns with @USPS operational changes this summer and the need for more transparency in the future. The Postmaster General agreed that better communication with Congress is necessary. Read more ⬇️ https://t.co/xVvVUarwnQ
Great move by @USDOL to issue this ruling on work visa programs. This decision protects American jobs and wages. https://t.co/HMX1M2zZaN

I joined @6News to react to President Trump testing positive for COVID-19.  I'm praying for President Trump and the First Lady and wish them both a speedy recovery. Along with the rest of the nation I'm hoping for positive news in the coming days about the First Family’s health. https://t.co/Ixtt745lz6

The HEROES Act 2.0 is so irresponsible 18 House Democrats voted against it. Responding to COVID-19 needs to be for small businesses workers and families not advancing political agendas. https://t.co/Jhg4RcQaIJ

I just signed onto Rep. @HerreraBeutler's bipartisan discharge petition to bring a #PaycheckProtectionProgram extension bill to the floor for a vote and bypass obstruction from @SpeakerPelosi. Congress needs to deliver for small businesses and workers not play political games.

Joined Mayor @GlennJacobsTN and @LegacyParks Director Carol Evans for an exciting announcement. Plans are in the works to build a veterans memorial park that will overlook the East Tenn State Veterans Cemetery. I appreciate all the partners working to make this project a reality. https://t.co/R40AvAdlS1
Asian Carp must be stopped from entering East Tennessee waterways. Great move by @GovBillLee to form the Asian Carp Advisory Commission. https://t.co/Lq7W90P0WP

Clean energy shouldn't come at the expense of the energy jobs many Americans currently rely on. The bill House Democrats put on the floor today would create more energy problems than energy solutions. https://t.co/5M3FXAS1G1

I'm proud to serve on @HSBCgop and stand up for East Tennessee small businesses in Congress. Please join me in celebrating the American entrepreneurial spirit during Small Business Week! https://t.co/qQGz4Afkyy

40 minutes. That's how long members had to read the text of the 115-page continuing resolution before being called to the House Floor to vote. You can't vote for a bill when you don't know what's in it.  My full statement on last night's continuing resolution ⬇️⬇️⬇️ https://t.co/bC4dh5Nuxt

I just voted to prohibit Chinese goods made with Uyghur forced labor from being imported into the United States. Products created in work camps to enrich the Chinese Communist Party are not welcome here. I stand with the Uyghurs and all ethnic minorities persecuted by the CCP.

Clover Meadow Farm was the final stop on my East Tennessee Farm Tours! Opened in 2015 Clover Meadow Farm utilizes 50 acres to responsibly care for and curate their grass-fed cattle. Thank you for showing me around! https://t.co/1HkwrjgeEg

Joined NAIFA-Knoxville the local affiliate of the National Association of Insurance and Financial Advisors for its monthly meeting. I appreciate the opportunity to attend and give a legislative update. https://t.co/RYfacl80FE
On this Constitution Day we reflect upon the unique freedoms we enjoy as Americans and thank all the folks who bravely defended our nation’s values. https://t.co/EW3L5k01P7

Today I sent a letter to Department of Homeland Security Inspector General Cuffari urging him to thoroughly investigate the allegations of medical misconduct and forced hysterectomies at the Irwin County GA ICE facility. https://t.co/Qjrb8IAD0M

ICYMI: Microloans are an important tool used by small businesses to innovate and grow. My legislation the Microloan Transparency and Accountability Act will increase access to these loans for rural small businesses.  I spoke about my bill before it passed the House on Monday⬇️ https://t.co/kj0onX98ZX

Reports of abuse and medical malpractice at the ICE facility in Irwin County GA are extremely disturbing. Congress needs to get to the bottom of what happened at this facility and hold ICE officials accountable if these reports are true.
Today was a historic day towards peace and prosperity in the Middle East. https://t.co/bR8GNfxz5D
Click the link below to watch the tour enjoy! https://t.co/w2X4FytAqb

Today I am proud to launch the Virtual Capitol Tour Experience a video guided tour of the United States Capitol Building. I hope East Tennesseans will use the Virtual Capitol Tour Experience for tourism and educational purposes until my office can host in-person tours again.

Hosting East Tennesseans for guided Capitol tours is one of the most important services provided by my office. With the Capitol closed to in-person tours for the time being we needed to find ways to continue providing this important service.

The Microloan Transparency and Accountability Act is my first piece of legislation to pass the House of Representatives! I am proud of this legislation that will help more rural small businesses access the Small Business Administration's microloan program. https://t.co/h4NglRd7dQ

It was an honor to receive the Defender of Housing Award from the National Association of Homebuilders. I appreciate @HBAGK nominating me for the award which recognizes federal legislators who have demonstrated strong support for the housing industry. https://t.co/3HGLgYKgA8

On the 19th anniversary of the 9/11 attacks it is important to remember the world is still working towards peace and stability in the Middle East. Today’s announcement that Bahrain and Israel are normalizing relations is progress towards peacefully achieving this goal.
On this day 19 years ago our nation suffered an enormous tragedy. We will never forget the lives lost on Sept. 11 2001. https://t.co/jnYZYYX10d

Judge Pamela Reeves was a good friend and she’ll be missed. Not only did she have a remarkable legal and public service career but as the first female Chief Judge of the Eastern District of Tennessee she was a trailblazer. Charles and her entire family are in my prayers.

My next farm tour was at Shanks Genetics a small family-owned sheep farm located in Lenoir City. The Shanks work with 4-H and FAA members and specialize in raising Southdown Shropshire and cross-bred sheep. https://t.co/CxZTYErV0w
Happy Labor Day! https://t.co/6g6rEKLKO4

My farm tours continue with a visit to Cherry Brook Farm in Philadelphia which is owned and operated by the Richesin family. David Becky and their sons are fifth-generation farmers who specialize in growing grain corn and soybeans. https://t.co/mTrzO1Gnwk

Washington’s spending priorities need to change. This fiscal outlook points to an unstable economic future and that should concern every American. Without a budget and continued financial mismanagement in Congress we are mortgaging the future of our financial health. https://t.co/IH7YSYNDpu

I stopped by the Boys & Girls Clubs of the Tennessee Valley today to tour the Haslam Family Club University and learn more about how their team is stepping up to assist Knox County students during the pandemic. https://t.co/sdIHl0zGIu

Located in Philadelphia Sweetwater Valley Farms is best known for its locally-made cheeses but the really unique aspect of this dairy farm is its use of robotic technology for milking its cows. I enjoyed meeting with the Harrison family and taking a tour of their farm. https://t.co/YOc9DbbaEw
Congratulations to the Knox County elected officials taking their oaths of office today. https://t.co/pU8vY7h71x

Hickory Corner Dairy is a family-owned dairy farm located in Speedwell. The Shipley family exclusively sells its milk though a cooperative with Weigels. It was good to spend some time touring the Shipley’s farm and learning more about the hard work that goes into dairy farming. https://t.co/UdDytvlHTC

It was a special honor to attend the dedication of the Captain Johnny Leon Bryant Memorial Highway this morning which is located on US-129 near the Tail of the Dragon. Capt. Bryant was born and raised in Blount… https://t.co/FUZjSMgWBJ

Grainger County is famous for its tomatoes and an East Tennessee farm tour wouldn’t be complete without a trip to a tomato farm. Located in Rutledge Stratton Farms supplies produce to restaurants and grocery stores across the region. https://t.co/mPY4yEdx3Q
Joined the Knoxville Auto Dealers Association for its monthly meeting. Got to share a legislative update and answer questions about what’s going on in DC. https://t.co/OG3e3ZVjZB
My statement on the @TVAnews announcement to reduce rates and renew the Community Cares Fund⬇️⬇️⬇️ https://t.co/TjiZEt1M4a

My farm tours continue with a visit to Mitchell Family Farm in Blaine. @MitchellBeef pasture raise their cattle antibiotic free and with no added hormones. They’re regulars at local farmers markets and they  supply beef to many area restaurants. https://t.co/M5Z6Ct2n64

Invasive Asian Carp destroy the ecosystems in our nation's waterways and prevent folks from being able to fully enjoy lakes rivers and streams. I'm proud to work with East Tennesseans to prevent Asian Carp from entering local waters and to control populations of these pests. https://t.co/MnlzH81yzA

I was proud to attend the UT Tower ribbon cutting this morning at the former TVA East Tower. This partnership between Knox County the University of Tennessee and TVA is a win for everyone. Congratulations to all those who helped make this project a reality. https://t.co/jAMSv9S3Im
Our tour of Eco-Rich Farms was really interesting. Located in Greenback this aquaponic farm uses a sustainable food production system to grow fish and vegetables. https://t.co/ukepPbz5Lr
Got to sit down with Jay Moser and talk about his 2000 acre farming operation in Jefferson County. For three decades Jay has specialized in growing corn and soybean crops. https://t.co/5A4B0FlFp0

Got the opportunity to welcome and congratulate Knox County’s four newest commissioners during their orientation yesterday.  As a former county mayor I understand what a privilege it is to work in local government and I know these folks will serve our community well. https://t.co/isGIldUO5x
This next farm tour took us to New Market. A fifth-generation livestock farm established in 1867 Loy Stock Farm focuses on raising cattle and hogs. https://t.co/7oL1igGZGT

We can’t go home without a coronavirus relief deal – Speaker Pelosi on July 26.  Then she recessed the House when negotiations didn’t go her way.   She was right the first time. Congress needs to stay in town after Saturday’s messaging vote to work on a sensible relief bill.

Our next farm tour took us to Holden Nursery in Mascot where we also spent some time with the Knox County Farm Bureau Women’s Group. The Holdens sell their plants flowers and ornamentals both retail and wholesale so they had an interesting small business perspective to share. https://t.co/g0M9lXjxWK

Regulations often do more harm than good for American workers and businesses. Federal agencies must justify why a regulation is necessary and be transparent about its impacts on our economy. More about the Protecting Jobs and Wages from Regulations Act ⬇️ https://t.co/ads9UfhsXM

USPS made the right call. As I said in my letter to Postmaster General DeJoy I support efforts to make public agencies more efficient but it’s clear these recent changes did just the opposite. https://t.co/sFBpQGH3FT
My farm tours continue with a stop at Bailey Family Farm in Strawberry Plains. I got the opportunity to talk to Jason about his cattle and the livestock auction he runs. https://t.co/fPYl4HCSTg

Over the next couple weeks I’ll be touring farms across East Tennessee to talk directly to local farmers about the important work they do and the issues they’re facing. We kicked off the farm tours with a visit to Zavels Family Farms in Corryton. https://t.co/TiNassOMmj
Today I sent separate letters to Postmaster General DeJoy and Speaker Pelosi seeking answers for their questionable actions. https://t.co/kDFhdyrN5f

At the same time its a shame @SpeakerPelosi is prioritizing messaging bills over a bipartisan Coronavirus relief bill. Congress needs to be in Washington working through the committee process ensuring all Americans' voices are heard to deliver an effective federal response.

East Tennesseans and the American public deserve answers from Postmaster General DeJoy. The Postmaster General’s ineffective USPS changes disrupted mail service for small businesses seniors and veterans. I'm disappointed these abrupt changes were made without any notification.

Anyone who’s had a friend or family member in hospice care knows what important and impactful work it is. I was honored to attend and be asked to say a few words at the Sacred Ground Residential Hospice groundbreaking this morning. https://t.co/V6T4S5LkCf
The agreement between Israel and the United Arab Emirates to normalize their relations is a landmark moment for the Middle East! Read my full statement below. https://t.co/NNoKnhgnpv

Joined members of the @knoxchamber this morning to talk about federal liability legislation. We need to get our economy going again but we need to do it safely. I applaud the Tennessee General Assembly for stepping up and passing the Recovery and Safe Harbor Act. https://t.co/74psuNJrCm

Negotiations over the next #COVID19 relief package were a disaster and show Congress’ dysfunction. This is what happens if major decisions are left up to a few party leaders. Americans lose when Congress skips the committee process or refuses to work with the President.

Joined the Associated Builders and Contractors - Greater Tennessee Chapter to give a legislative update talk about my Easy Access to Mail Act and answer questions on what’s happening in Washington. https://t.co/ZfjxzKtINy

TVA made the right call to reverse course on outsourcing American jobs. It was wrong to begin with especially during a pandemic. Thank you @realDonaldTrump for getting involved and standing up for America’s working folks! https://t.co/xq4cb3eWz2
I appreciate the @TellicoVillage POA inviting me to speak at its board meeting today. https://t.co/46cmahVRba

If businesses are protecting their customers employees and public health they deserve to be shielded from frivolous COVID-19 lawsuits.  Liability protections are crucial to our economic recovery and they need to be part of the next #COVID19 relief bill. https://t.co/HRLfJdN2yM
I do not support moving or delaying the 2020 election. It is up to Congress to make that decision and this year’s election is still scheduled to be held on November 3rd as planned.

✅ H.R 7623 the Passport Backlog Elimination Act passed out of @HouseForeignGOP today!   The State Department needs to tell Congress and passport applicants how it plans to eliminate the passport application backlog.   Proud to work with @GerryConnolly on this legislation. https://t.co/FlxfzOTly3

Earlier today I voted in favor of the Great American Outdoors Act. Proud to support this legislation that strengthens the Great Smoky Mountains National Park! https://t.co/l9GWStlVLT

John Lewis will forever hold a special place in our nation’s history as a leader in the Civil Rights Movement and in Congress. He lived an incredible life full of courage and integrity. This country owes him an enormous amount of gratitude and I'm praying for his family tonight.

The $4.67 billion disaster relief bill voted on by the House was misleading because the funds aren’t exclusively for Puerto Rico. Rather than a vote to throw more money at the problem we should’ve started by managing the $8 billion in disaster funds we’ve already appropriated.

Our federal government responded to recent disasters in Puerto Rico by directing HUD to release over $8 billion in disaster aid. This was just a few weeks ago. We need to see if this relief is working before Congress votes to spend billions more.

The Puerto Rican government did the right thing by firing these officials for stashing away much needed disaster aid but before authorizing more funding Congress needs assurance that this kind of negligence won’t happen again. https://t.co/EEHb9iG0Zt

CBO Director Phillip Swagel will be testifying before the budget committee this morning. I look forward to hearing what he has to say about irresponsible government spending as well as the additional findings in his report.

This report shows the need to limit how much Congress can spend. My legislation the RAFT Act limits public debt to an amount less than total GDP. This puts a check on Congress preventing politicians from overspending and spiraling our county into further debt.

The CBO report states public debt is currently 81% of total GDP. It will reach 98% by 2030 and 180% by 2050. Congress's spending habits are out of control and we cannot continue spending taxpayer dollars as if they are unlimited.

The Trump Administration’s Middle East peace plan announcement is a step in the right direction and I hope it leads to productive talks between the Israelis and Palestinians. I’ll review the plan as more details are released.
